PolicyDocument.Description: The JSON document that describes the policy.

PolicyName.Description: The name (the physical ID) of the AWS IoT policy.

ThingName.Description: The name (the physical ID) of the AWS IoT thing.

Principal.Description: The principal, which can be a certificate ARN (as returned from the                                 CreateCertificate operation) or an Amazon Cognito ID.

RuleName.Description: The name (the physical ID) of the AWS IoT rule.

TopicRulePayload.Description: The actions associated with the AWS IoT rule.

Principal.Description: The principal, which can be a certificate ARN (as returned from the                                 CreateCertificate operation) or an Amazon Cognito ID.

ThingName.Description: The name of the AWS IoT thing.

Attributes.Description: A string that contains up to three keyâ€“value pairs. Maximum length of 800. Duplicates                                 not allowed.

Actions.Description: The actions associated with the rule.

AwsIotSqlVersion.Description: The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.

RuleDisabled.Description: Specifies whether the rule is disabled.

Sql.Description: The SQL statement that queries the topic. For more information, see Rules for AWS IoT                                 in the AWS IoT Developer Guide.

CloudwatchAlarm.Description: Changes the state of a CloudWatch alarm.

DynamoDB.Description: Writes data to a DynamoDB table.

DynamoDBv2.Description: Writes data to a DynamoDB table.

Elasticsearch.Description: Writes data to an Elasticsearch domain.

Firehose.Description: Writes data to a Kinesis Firehose stream.

Kinesis.Description: Writes data to an Kinesis stream.

Republish.Description: Publishes data to an MQ Telemetry Transport (MQTT) topic different from the one                                 currently specified.

S3.Description: Writes data to an S3 bucket.

Sns.Description: Publishes data to an SNS topic.

Sqs.Description: Publishes data to an SQS queue.

RoleArn.Description: The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch alarm.

StateReason.Description: The reason for the change of the alarm state.

StateValue.Description: The value of the alarm state.

MetricName.Description: The name of the CloudWatch metric.

MetricNamespace.Description: The name of the CloudWatch metric namespace.

MetricUnit.Description: The metric unit                                 supported by Amazon CloudWatch.

MetricValue.Description: The value to publish to the metric. For example, if you count the occurrences                                 of a particular term such as Error, the value will be 1                                 for each occurrence.

RoleArn.Description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the CloudWatch metric.

HashKeyField.Description: The name of the hash key.

HashKeyType.Description: The data type of the hash key (also called the partition key). Valid values are: "STRING" or "NUMBER".

HashKeyValue.Description: The value of the hash key.

PayloadField.Description: The name of the column in the DynamoDB table that contains the result of the query.                                 You                                 can customize this name.

RangeKeyField.Description: The name of the range key.

RangeKeyType.Description: The data type of the range key (also called the sort key). Valid values are: "STRING" or "NUMBER".

RangeKeyValue.Description: The value of the range key.

RoleArn.Description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.

TableName.Description: The name of the DynamoDB table.

PutItem.Description: Specifies the database table to which to write the item for an AWS IoT topic rule.

RoleArn.Description: The IAM role that allows access to the DynamoDB table. At a minimum, the role must                                 allow the dynamoDB:PutItem IAM action.

TableName.Description: The name of the DynamoDB table.NoteThe MQTT message payload must contain a root-level key that matches the table's primary                                    partition key and a root-level key that matches the table's primary sort key, if one                                    is defined. For more information, see DynamoDBv2 Action in the  AWS IoT Developer Guide..

Endpoint.Description: The endpoint of your Elasticsearch domain.

Id.Description: A unique identifier for the stored data.

Index.Description: The Elasticsearch index where the data is stored.

RoleArn.Description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to Elasticsearch.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants access to the                                 Kinesis Firehose stream.

Separator.Description: A character separator that's used to separate records written to the Kinesis Firehose                                 stream. For valid values, see Firehose Action in the AWS IoT Developer Guide.

PartitionKey.Description: The partition key (the grouping of data by shard within an Kinesis                                 stream).

RoleArn.Description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to an Kinesis stream.

StreamName.Description: The name of the Kinesis stream.

FunctionArn.Description: The ARN of the Lambda function.

RoleArn.Description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants publishing access.

Topic.Description: The name of the MQTT topic topic different from the one currently                                 specified.

BucketName.Description: The name of the S3 bucket.

Key.Description: The object key (the name of an object in the S3 bucket).

RoleArn.Description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to Amazon S3.

MessageFormat.Description: The format of the published message.  Amazon SNS uses this setting to determine                                 whether it should parse the payload and extract the platform-specific bits from                                 the payload.For more information, see Appendix:                                    Message and JSON Formats in the                                 Amazon Simple Notification Service Developer Guide.

RoleArn.Description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to Amazon SNS.

TargetArn.Description: The ARN of the Amazon SNS topic.

QueueUrl.Description: The URL of the Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue.

RoleArn.Description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to Amazon SQS.

UseBase64.Description: Specifies whether Base64 encoding should be used.
